snippet.title: Top barrister fined for contempt
snippet.content:
A BRISBANE barrister who claimed the $50,000 in cash that former Ipswich mayor Paul Pisasale was found with at Melbourne airport has been fined for contemptuous comments made to a magistrate. Sam Di Carlo appeared in the Brisbane Supreme Court yesterday over contempt proceedings brought by the attorney-general in relation to comments he made to magistrate John Costello in January last year.
Former Ipswich mayor Paul Pisasale has been released on bail following strict conditions set by the judge. Courtesy: 9 News
Former Ipswich mayor Paul Pisasale released on bail While noting all lawyers experience frustration at times, Chief Justice Catherine Holmes agreed Mr Di Carlo's remarks amounted to contempt and fined him $4000, to be paid within three months.
